ygData.subject: Re: Pricing, skills, and other smithing stuff
ygData.messageBody:
>From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>

< snip some of Kelly's answers >

Most of Kelly's directions are perfect. There's just a few corrections to
the zone names and a couple of compass headings.

>To get to High Hold from Qeynos:
>-If under level 15 or so ... put EVERYTHING into the bank except food. You
won't be
>able to kill mobs on most of the maps so you will be avoiding combat. If
you die or get
>lost .... who cares, all of your items are in the bank.
>-Leave Queynos north on the road. Zone into Qeynos Hills.

so far so good :)

>-After zoning in, follow the road to the marker, take the right path (going
east) all
>the way along the road and through the valley until you zone into East
Karana.

That's West Karana.

>-Continue following the road into East Karana to the first road marker,
turn right,
>following the road to the south until the road ends .. and you are running
on the bare
>plains. Go south all the way to the water.
>-Turn east, following the water all the way across the map (a long way).
Zone into West
>Karana.

That's actually North Karana.

>-Continue on this zone along the water. You will come to a large white
bridge. Do not
>cross it. Continue again along the water heading east. There will be one
raider camp
>along the way, just against the water. Go around it by swimming, or running
into the
>plains jut a little.
>-You will come to a second bridge, this one will be wooden, and shaped like
a large
>linked chain. Turn south and cross this bridge .. in the middle you will
zone into
>South Karana.

You'll actually be turning east and zoning into East Karana.

>-After exiting the bridge, follow the water left (again east) until you can
just see

north

>the mountains coming up. In the water is a large NPC you will want to avoid
called
>Bruune. Skirt areound him and go up the mountain face until you cannot
climb any
>higher.
>-Turn South and follow the mountain all the way to a valley when you must
run down. Do
>not go into the valley ... it zones into the Gorge.

east

>-Instead, go up the mountain on the other side, and once again go to the
top, and
>continue running south. You will eventually reach a corner where you will
have to curve

east

>around and run west. Continue running west along the mountain top to the
next valley.

south

>-Looking into the valley you will see road winding up on the right hand
side. Take this
>route and follow it up all the way around the mountains (quite a hike). You
will zone
>into the High Hold map.
>-After zoning be careful!! There are gnolls and orcs on this map that are
high level.
>You most likely woudn't survive a fight with them so wait until they move
(they seem to
>patrol the area) and then sneak by. You will have to follow the left hand
wall around
>all the inlets in the rocks. If you see lights .. you are getting close to
the Keep.
>You will come to one inlet that leads to a tavern/inn. Come out of this and
contiue
>left to the next inlet which should be the hold main entrance.
>-Go into the hold, zone to it's map, cross the coutyard and go into the
keep. follow
>the hallway down and back to a large chamber with columns in it.
>-At the back of the chamber is a set of steps going down. They will lead to
a mine
>entrance. A miner just in the entrance sells sharpening stones as well as
ore. Leaving
>him, as you return to go back upstairs you should see the female bank
teller also.
>Place your stuff in here for safe keeping.
>-Follow the route back home or do like I do and explore until you get
killed, whereby
>you respawn in Qeynos and go to the bank to retrieve your items.
>
>- Don't get discouraged if you die ... I littered many of these maps with
my corpse ...
>you can too. :-p Try to use a concept called 'bordering' as much as
possible. Mobs
>don't seem to wander close to the map borders (mountains or water). Use
this to your
>advantage by running right up against the side of the map.
>
>Note: When looking at the main hold entrance if you turn around, directly
behind you,
>you will see a path leading up into the rocks. This path actually takes you
back to the
>other side of High Hold that exits to the Kithcor Woods on the way to
Freeport.
>
>Good Luck Praetor!!
>
>-Faderic of Qeynos (Eollorisi Marr Server)
>
>If you are on the same server, send me a tell. I would be glad to show you
the way
>there.
>
>


Mysk, Dwarven Paladin, Master Smith, Apprentice Tailor (E'ci Server)
